meanings.definition: A type of freshwater green algae characterized by a cell wall with two symmetrical halves.
meanings.sent1: The desmids in the pond have cell walls that look like two matching puzzle pieces.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study desmids to learn more about their unique cell structure.
meanings.sent3: The desmids in the lake were so perfectly symmetrical, they almost looked like tiny green butterflies.
meanings.sent4: Under the microscope, desmids resemble tiny green snowflakes with their symmetrical halves.
meanings.sent5: The teacher showed the students a picture of desmids to help them understand the concept of symmetry in nature.

meanings.definition: Organisms belonging to the family Desmidiaceae, typically found in ponds and lakes.
meanings.sent1: Many desmids live happily in the calm waters of the pond.
meanings.sent2: The biologist discovered a new species of desmids during her research in the lake.
meanings.sent3: The desmids in the pond had a family reunion to celebrate their unique lineage.
meanings.sent4: In the world of ponds and lakes, desmids are the royalty of the water kingdom.
meanings.sent5: Children love to observe desmids swimming gracefully in the clear pond water.

meanings.definition: Single-celled algae with a distinctive shape and intricate cell structure.
meanings.sent1: Under the microscope, the single-celled desmids looked like tiny pieces of art.
meanings.sent2: Desmids are fascinating single-celled organisms that play a crucial role in the ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The desmids in the petri dish seemed to be having a dance party under the microscope.
meanings.sent4: In the world of single-celled organisms, desmids stand out like intricate jewels.
meanings.sent5: The intricate cell structure of desmids is a marvel of nature's design.
